meanings.definition: The quality of being aggressive or combative.
meanings.sent1: His aggressivity in sports made him a fierce competitor.
meanings.sent2: Her aggressivity in negotiations helped her secure a better deal.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's aggressivity towards the toy mouse was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The storm's aggressivity towards the coastline was relentless.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's aggressivity in teaching motivated the students to work harder.

meanings.definition: The tendency to initiate hostile or violent behavior.
meanings.sent1: The dog's aggressivity towards strangers was a concern for the owner.
meanings.sent2: The aggressivity of the protestors led to clashes with the police.
meanings.sent3: The cake's aggressivity towards the ice cream was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The aggressivity of the storm clouds foretold a heavy downpour.
meanings.sent5: The aggressivity of the virus spread quickly among the population.

meanings.definition: The state of being inclined to attack or confront.
meanings.sent1: The aggressivity of the lioness protected her cubs from danger.
meanings.sent2: His aggressivity in debates often led to heated arguments.
meanings.sent3: The tree's aggressivity towards the fence caused some damage.
meanings.sent4: The aggressivity of the waves eroded the shore over time.
meanings.sent5: The aggressivity of the competitor pushed him to strive for excellence.
